text: The 2015 EBSA European Under-21 Snooker Championships took place from 21 to 26 March 2015 in Qawra, Malta. The tournament was won by the number 4 seed Darryl Hill of Mannin who defeated England's Louis Heathcote 6–3 in the final to win the championships, as a result Hill was given a two-year card on the professional World Snooker Tour for the 2015/2016 and 2016/2017 seasons. ==Results== ===Round 1=== Best of 5 frames {| width="100%" cellspacing="5" |- !width=5%| !width=40%| !width=10%| !width=5%|
